name: luminosity

[ U or S ] the state of producing or reflecting bright light; the state of appearing to shine: The photographer achieved the luminosity in the image through careful manipulation in the darkroom. The light was crystalline, giving everything a shimmering luminosity.

[ U or C ]
  environment , physics
  specialized the brightness of a star, comet, etc.: The object of the project is to investigate the mass and luminosity of nearby stars. The stars have high surface temperatures (50,000 kelvins and up) and luminosities (100,000 suns and greater).
[ U ]
  physics
  specialized the measurement of the rate at which an object produces radiation: The X-ray luminosity from a galaxy cluster can be used to find its centre very accurately. See
